intro: Aframomum korarima, commonly known as the African grain of paradise, is a flowering plant native to western Africa. It is a member of the ginger family (Zingiberaceae) and is characterized by its tall, erect stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are followed by red, fleshy fruits containing numerous seeds. Its rhizomes are often used in traditional medicine and as a spice due to their aromatic and pungent properties.
